page.title: 07CHURCHES
page.content: 1. Littlebury Green{church}is a different type of church from many of the other churches.It is made out of green corrugated iron sheets outside and inside it is made out of wood.The church will be 100 years old in 1985. The church is used for community services like mothers and toddlers club.The pews are portable. 2. Littlebury church dates from the middle of the 12th centuary when Littlebury was owned by the Bishop of Ely who owned Gates house farm.The north aisle and what was the south transcept were built in 1325.The font is traditionally Norman but the cover is Tudor. 3. Strethall's church is away from the village because when the{plague attacked the village the bodies were taken to a field and buried.The church was built afterwards.
